alert.note: Alert for Floyd (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 12:13PM EST until further notice by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Armuchee Creek at Old Dalton Road near Rome affecting Floyd County. Alcovy River near Alcovy River above Covington affecting Walton and Newton Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Armuchee Creek at Old Dalton Road near Rome. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Flood stage is reached. Minor flooding of woodlands...fields and pastures begins along the creek upstream and downstream from the gage on Old Dalton Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:45 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 19.6 feet and falling. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:45 AM EST Wednesday was 19.7 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 19.4 feet on 09/01/2021. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 1215 AM EST.
